website_summaries.verdict: Great option when you have to carry boards up to 1-1/8 inches in thickness.
pros: Inexpensive device that gives you the ability to carry thicker pieces versus some other gripping plate tools
Uses a lot of metal in the construction, so it should last a long time for continuous use
Will work to carry two thinner panels or sheets at the same time
cons: Because of the angle of the handle, sheets must be lifted higher than normal

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: The bar that supports the handle and connect to the main vise part of the lift should have been 2 bars on either side as your fingers have to straddle on either side of the pretty thick bar when holding the handle. Making it pretty uncomfortable to use which completely nullifies the point of using something like this to making this easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kirik

customer_reviews.title: Late review, wanted some time using the product before I left one.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait for a little while of using the product before leaving a review. This has to to with weight and heavy use. The durability is good so far and its going into a month of routine daily use. The package arrived promptly, I like that I was emailed to see how the product was doing for us and to let them know if we needed them. I removed one star because occasionally it doesn't grab properly and you have to shake it. This isn't often at all its happened like 4 or 5 times in a month of constant use. Overall this is a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Excellent one hand carry tool
customer_reviews.text: For hand carry of drywall, we much prefer this over any bottom carry tool, as this one allows a true one arm carry. Squat under it, stand up, and you are moving. Surprisingly easy. Having a free hand while carrying helps immensely. Just watch for cross-winds if outside. It appears very well made. The only caveat for drywall is to make sure the tool surfaces are flat against the sheet before lifting. If the back plate is tilted, it will bite off the drywall. Other than that, this is an excellent hand tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: I operate a home improvement business and often find myself lugging sheets of plywood and 3/8 paneling, even up extension ladders. Able to handle 1 1/8" material it is much improved over the 3/4" limitations of the Gorilla Gripper. With the Gator Lift I can even carry other awkward sized sheet goods and 1" doors.
customer_reviews.author: F. Couperus

customer_reviews.title: Be careful how you lift sheetrock with it ...
customer_reviews.text: The paddle on the back must be carefully aligned with the sheetrock. If it's not aligned properly the paddle will break the sheetrock. Seems like a spring would be a nice addition to the tool because as it is the paddle will misalign without one hand holding it in place as you lift.
customer_reviews.author: JAY B SWINDLE

customer_reviews.title: STURDY AND  WORKS FAIRLY WELL
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and tried it out. Its got a bit of looseness in the pieces that fit around the wood but it does work and it appears very strong. For a one man band its alot easier then trying to walk through a door with a peice of plywood telling yourself i got it i got it! And then without it you have to set it back down and get another grip. If you get this product its durable enough to get a good grip. It all depends on the strength in your wrist actually. This handle looks like it can take alot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph  Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Works well but just not my preferred tool
customer_reviews.text: Device works great but turns out that I prefer my sheetgoods hooks that pickup the sheet from the bottom. I had high hopes for this device, but it just wasn’t a comfortable way for me to carry heavy sheets of stuff like melamine.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Collett

customer_reviews.title: Watch how it grabs
customer_reviews.text: I destroyed a couple sheets of sheetrock using this tool. Check to make sure the jaw grabs correctly against the outside panel before you lift. The issue is edge of the jaw can grab or dig in to the panel when you lift it, and it's outside your vision. I was carrying green boards and they are extra heavy. The edge of this tool cut right through this sheetrock due to its weight. I find this tool useful in close quarters but not running through the backyard, like from the road. I went right back to the old Stanley carrying lift from the bottom; so much easier on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic item!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item is amazing. My husband is 68 years old and it is hard for him to carry sheetrock and plywood by himself. This is fantastic and doesn't put a strain on his back.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K.

customer_reviews.title: Needs wider jaws
customer_reviews.text: It works great. It would be better if the jaws were a little wider so it wpuld accommodate doors.
customer_reviews.author: F. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but when I got this thing I immediately went into the shop and picked up some heavy 8x4 exterior paneling. The paneling was still heavy (of course) but this gripper made it *very* easy to get under the top and pick it up from the middle. I would love to see a dual clamp version connected with a 2' bar for added stability. Hopefully I didn't just give away an awesome invention!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ruby Built The Pyramids

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this
customer_reviews.text: I like to do woodworking and little projects but always find it to be such a pain carrying sheets of plywood in from the garage and around my workshop. They are awkward and heavy and there is no good way to get my hands around them to have a secure grip. This thing fixes all of that. It attaches without any real effort and makes carrying full sheets very easy. Just lift with one hand, put your hand sort of over your shoulder and it's a breeze to move. I almost didn't get it because it's a lot to spend on something that I won't really use super often, but I'm gland I did. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: aglowucannotsee

customer_reviews.title: Not good for drywall, only good for plywood
customer_reviews.text: For plywood it works, it broke the drywall sheets when I tried to use it with drywall. Only get this if you are looking to move large, thick sheets of plywood by yourself
customer_reviews.author: Davey hg

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!  Totally Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The gator lift is totally awesome! I have been looking for a quality panel carrier for a long time and finally found what I was looking for. I am able to easily move panels without having to put my arms in awkward positions, I just grab what I need and go. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: this is the best tool I ever purchased considering the ease with which ...
customer_reviews.text: I got to say, this is the best tool I ever purchased considering the ease with which I can handle 4'x8' sheaths of anything; right now I am carrying 3/4 melamine sheaths that weigh 96lb and this tool makes it feel like a breeze; I got two of them, I use it for carrying European style cabinet boxes inside houses, up the stairs or not, it works great; if you really want to enjoy what you do when it comes to handling large sheaths and whatever else this grip lift allows, go for it, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: D/P

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money even for a single job
customer_reviews.text: Was doing some DIY sheathing in the basement and had a stack of 4x8 OCB delivered to the house. This thing was a life saver for handling heavy, awkward boards. I questioned if I needed it for a single diy job, but I'm so glad I got this. Totally worth it, and nice to have for other heavy items that this will fit. It's worth having in any decent home workshop.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and I use it a lot
customer_reviews.text: if you are moving a lot of panels I would say this is a must buy. I knocked it a star because you have to be careful not to break panels as it could add some twist during lift (I broke one). I've also moved cement boards which are a real "bee itch" normally.
customer_reviews.author: Colin MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: It works, but I prefer lifting from the bottom
customer_reviews.text: This product does work, but for heavier sheets, I think I would rather be able to lift from the bottom. It's just not that comfortable to lift and it puts a lot of strain on your elbow and shoulder. It is much easier using the tools that allow you to lift from the bottom and keep your arm straight. I keep this around the shop, but I use it only on lighter sheet goods.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Took a bite out of my drywall sheet
customer_reviews.text: It works as long as the clamps are engaged flatly against the drywall sheet. I forgot to check the clamps after I put the sheet down against the wall. They torn a chunk out of my 1/2” sheetrock when I lifted it leaning against my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Junej

customer_reviews.title: Not great for one 1⁄2" 4'x8' sheetrock
customer_reviews.text: It's very, very easy to destroy a large area where this tool grips on a single panel of sheetrock... and not when picking it up, but while in transit. It's also terrible for going up stairs or around turns. I've had to resort to using my bare hands again. I'll give it one more shot today...
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly nice!
customer_reviews.text: I skeptically purchased this thinking how wimpy I have become to desire to have a better way of moving large, flat, planar objects, such as plywood, drywall, and the like. After using it, I don't even care. Was able to confidently carry plywood through narrow hallways, without bumping into stuff on the way. It is well made and I think repairable if it broke. Big thick aluminum with metal pins to swivel on. Well worth it, even if I'll get made fun of for using it. Why work harder when you can work smarter?
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Will break your drywall every time !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot be used for carrying drywall it will break your drywall every time no matter how hard you try it snaps off the edges the way it's designed do not buy this for carrying drywall as it says in the advertisement this is totally false bad product , bad marketing
customer_reviews.author: William J townsend

customer_reviews.title: One person can handle 4 x 8 sheets of heavy plywood with this gripper
customer_reviews.text: Finally, someone invented a product to make it easy to handle 4 x 8 sheets of heavy plywood. Normally you need two people to handle bulky sheets of plywood. With this item you just put the handle in the middle and you can lift plywood onto a table to cut, or carry it from room to room. A must have for the do it yourself person.
customer_reviews.author: Northeast Consumer

customer_reviews.title: doesnt hold 5/8 sheetrock
customer_reviews.text: works great with 1/2 and smaller sheetrock and panels. Will not hold 5/8 sheetrock. Its wide enough and grips it but when lifted the sheetrock falls out, Though about trying a rubber insert like a piece of innertube or rubber shelf liner to help it "grip". On the smaller size stock it works great
customer_reviews.author: ncman424

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Made carrying full sheets of 3/4 inch plywood a breeze. What is normally heavy and awkward for one person now becomes very doable. I will get a ton of use out of this. Well worth the small price to not struggle getting sheet goods into the truck for my projects.
customer_reviews.author: awalker

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This thing provides that extra help when none is around. I've used it for 4x8 sheets of sheetrock, plywood, & mdf. As long as you are careful when attaching and get it as centered as you can from front to back, it makes otherwise unmanageable lift possible. Not sure why the home stores don't sell these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: Use to lift drywall - very good and can do with just 1 person.
customer_reviews.author: Raz Jaay

customer_reviews.title: Kind of awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it a lot but my first thought was it's just okay. It's kind of awkward to carry a single sheet of plywood using the gator lift because you have to hold it over (or at) your shoulder; I think it's easier to just carry the sheet by grabbing at the top and bottom. However, I thing it might be easier to use gator lifts if you have two people carrying a single sheet and each of you are using one of these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great when moving *vertically*
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what is claims: allows you to move large sheets of plywood around as long as you hold it vertically. (I bring mine to Home Depot). Be advised once you try to tilt it away from about 15 degrees off vertical it will drop the sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Bires

customer_reviews.title: Another thing I should have bought way sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is so handy it's ridiculous! The leverage you get on a sheet of ply is great. Makes moving around the shop so much easier and when you're at the home center by yourself it makes loading so much easier. Don't know what I didn't buy it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: BinDC

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Moving my wood shop across town, mostly alone I had some sheets of mdf typically this is a 2 man job and you’re both warn out at the end. I was able to do it alone and not feel sore at lunch. Time and back saver I plan to buy more for my shop
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Essential!
customer_reviews.text: I had to install 11 sheets of osb today by myself, and this product greatly simplified the process. I have 11 more to go tomorrow, and I trust it will handle it. Grips every time. Built well. Seems a little expensive, but what is the alternative?
customer_reviews.author: Snugs

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Take time to make sure the back plate is seated correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. You have to make sure the back plat is perfectly flat or you can tear the top couple of inches off the sheet rock where the carrier is, which could result in dropping the sheet and losing it.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, price worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great Tool- very well made, price worth it, wish I'd found this years ago, (so good neighbors are trying continually to borrow them, I don't think so going to hang on to them these don't get loaned out.)
customer_reviews.author: MEC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’m a woman in my mid 30s 5’ 2” and definitely not fit. I am able to maneuver 4x8 sheets of 3/4 inch treated plywood by myself. Now, it’s still heavy but I can lift and carry it to wherever I need it to work with it. Definitely recommend this to anyone that moves sheets of anything ever.
customer_reviews.author: acowger

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty skeptical at first
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical at first, but WOW this really works. Its actually a lot heavier duty than I originally thought. I used this attached to the end of a rope and pulley in order to lift plywood sheets to the second story. Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful
customer_reviews.text: Really great product. I was able to move full sheets of 3/4 ply and MDF fairly easily. Obviously this doesn’t make the panels lighter, but if you can handle the weight it does make it possible to handle sheet goods by yourself where otherwise it might not be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well made & is heavy duty in design
customer_reviews.text: VERY heavy duty: well constructed and under normal usage - will not break or bend. I am very satisfied with the design and FUNCTION and it makes handling 3/4” sheet stock much easier to lift, carry and move.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Fujimoto

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This tool allowed me to carry 25 sheets of 4x8x3/4 sheets of OSB board (~70 lbs each) in and though the house on my own. Easy to lift and maneuver. Still holds when given little "bumps" to shift weight (as long as you don't let all the force off the handle) I think the only limitation to the product is how much force your wrist can take!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan J.

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: this makes handling full sheets of plywood a breeze. should have bought one of these long ago. I bought this one because it would grab the top of the sheet rather than under the bottom. this way I dont have to stoop over to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: cforcht

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly - well made. I remodel bathrooms and it's perfect for carrying panels and green board.
customer_reviews.author: V and Ladyblue

customer_reviews.title: One of the better tools I’ve come across
customer_reviews.text: This handle has made life much better. Carrying sheets of cement panel for siding on my own tears up my arm. With this simple yet sturdy handle, there are no more scrapes and cuts inside my arm. Also it’s easy as can be carrying sheets of heavy plywood.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: it is extremely well made and likely to easily last a life time
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth every penny I paid, it is extremely well made and likely to easily last a life time. If you want one get it now before it gets cheapened as all tools usually do.
customer_reviews.author: raymond s swan

customer_reviews.title: Really makes my life easier.
customer_reviews.text: Has made a world of difference in the ease of handling plywood in my life. It makes it easy to handle an entire sheet by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Sonntag

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worth every penny - rock solid - happy with it's functionality... do it
customer_reviews.author: unboundzero

customer_reviews.title: Panel does not hang straight down
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to pick up and 4x8 panel but it wants to swing in to my leg. Otherwise great tool for me as I can't pick up a 4x8 sheet that easily any more. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kenkre1212

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: I was able to unload and move all of the drywall sheets for my garage by myself without breaking a single sheet. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Don G.

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy...
customer_reviews.text: It not so easy to carry one 3/4 8'x4' sheet of treated plywood. To find the appropriate position for the balance...not so easy if someone had to move several of them...
customer_reviews.author: Jose A Wong-Perez

customer_reviews.title: Works great for plywood.  Not sure about drywall
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for carrying sheets of plywood, OSB, etc. Not sure how well this would work with drywall. If not careful, you might bite a chunk out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love'it
customer_reviews.text: Makes moving sheet goods easy. Must admit I am not strong enough to carry 150 lb MDF by myself but it makes it a dam site easier for two to do so
customer_reviews.author: reddogm

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for moving heavy 4X8 MDF sheets
customer_reviews.text: I’m useing this to move 3/4” MDF sheets around my shop and it works great. This has been the only way I have found to move such heavy, ungainly sheets by myself. I highly recommend this device
customer_reviews.author: Mary Reif

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to have around
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick. Makes carrying sheet goods a bit easier. The challenge is rather than using two hands and stressing your shoulders, you end up taxing just one arm. But it's a must on stairs, especially.
customer_reviews.author: argiope

customer_reviews.title: this was one I was happy to see him get
customer_reviews.text: The nag my husband is a wood worker or he likes to think he is and with it goes lots of toys, this was one I was happy to see him get, and use it working smarter an not harder
customer_reviews.author: Terri Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it is a little hard if you have wrist problems. But does help move plywood a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brabender

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Makes is possible for me to carry a full 3/4 MDF sheet! Make sure you have good wrists tho!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Carrion

customer_reviews.title: Great for one person to move plywood
customer_reviews.text: I use it to move 3/4" sheets of plywood around in the shop. Very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Rough Rider

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool To Have Around!
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool to have around the house. Awkward to carry plywood as it is, but this tool made it a lot easier. The large sheets are still heavy toting from the shoulder but still, for the money, I have no regrets. I grabbed a piece of sheetrock with it thinking I was going somewhere. Never do that! Had a duh huh moment. Turns out, I didn't need the whole sheet anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Lifting and Carry for Plywood
customer_reviews.text: Great investment for ergonomic way to carry heavy sheets of plywood.
customer_reviews.author: John Wiese

customer_reviews.title: Not for moving drywall
customer_reviews.text: You need to be 7ft tall to walk with them .Get the cheap plastic ones. Mite be useful in the shop for move a sheet around. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: Works OK, but you can only use one arm to bear the panel weight.
customer_reviews.author: DannyBoy69

customer_reviews.title: This works great. I was able to carry large pieces of ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I was able to carry large pieces of plywood used to cover doors during a hurricane out to the storage building by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Grips well
customer_reviews.text: 4X8 plywood and 4X8 drywall are more easily managed with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: ivyman

customer_reviews.title: Makes carrying 4x8 sheets of OSB, plywood, and drywall easier.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and makes it easier for one person to carry heavy sheet goods. Not as useful if carrying them at an angle up stairs.
customer_reviews.author: S. Leiphart

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The guy at the hardware store wanted to know where I got it he loved it
customer_reviews.author: Edwin DeVore

customer_reviews.title: Back saver must have
customer_reviews.text: I bought several tools to help me hang Sheetrock after our house got flooded during Harvey. This one in particular has been the Best Buy. What a back saver! I was able to bring in 40 sheets by myself without getting hurt or strained. Pays its self off quickly by avoided doctors visits
customer_reviews.author: James Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive
customer_reviews.text: The gator lift is pretty incredible. After years of hauling drywall, plywood and other big sheets of stuff with my husband this thing is great. HOWEVER I still can't lift it alone but my husband can or I can use the gator lift while he helps. It really does work. Very well made - heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Michelle F

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the cost, makes handling 4x8 sheets much easier.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredRR

customer_reviews.title: Saves me TONS of effort moving sheetrock around for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Saves me TONS of effort moving sheetrock around for my basement project. I can see me finding all kinds of uses for this down the road. Very well made with no flex when lifting 2 4x12 sheets of rock.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER N.

customer_reviews.title: Goods and Bads
customer_reviews.text: The item itself was great and durable... it grips and is easy for the fingers but if puts a lot of stress on my back so that is the reason why im giving this a 2 star. i carried 1 sheet of plywood with this tool and ended up carrying the rest of the plywood the old fashion way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tools for the price I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tools for the price I have ever purchased. I needed to move 100lb rubber mats and gave this a try and it worked absolutely perfect. Strong metal and built
customer_reviews.author: chris O

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for our guys. Should decrease our L and I Claims.
customer_reviews.author: Greg LaBree

customer_reviews.title: Really glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: Had to move 20 sheets of 3/4 plywood from my driveway around back of the house by myself. Best $24 dollars I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: RMCCARRA

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier!
customer_reviews.text: I carried some plywood upstairs into the attic. 1/2" 4X8 - this made it much more manageable
customer_reviews.author: Pat in Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Gator Lift
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this product! Saves on the back!
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best inventions ever! It makes carrying plywood so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked the way it was suppose to, definitely easier than by hand
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving plywood MUCH easier!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during a move when I knew I had a lot of builds coming up and it is worth its weight in gold! Would recommend this to anyone who has to move sheet goods around.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good value and handy to have
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband. He was impressed by how easy it was to use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Park

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected, I’m just too short to get leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Geil

customer_reviews.title: Quality and fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Works better than exspected. Husband said it's a back saver
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, but the jaws need to be wider to accommodate a standard hollow core door.
customer_reviews.author: LarryF

customer_reviews.title: You work on plyboard panels? This makes the job of hauling then easier.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly. A must for carry large panels of wood. Easy to use. Saved my back
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kern

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it does. Didn’t work great carrying more than one sheet of osb at a time (the sheets would slide out).
customer_reviews.author: CBarn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, durable, makes handling plywood a lot easier
customer_reviews.text: The older i get the harder it is to carry plywood by myself. The gator lift carrier has made it easier and helps prevent muscle strain.
customer_reviews.author: e9snipe

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Item and delivery as described, Thank you! This is the greatest tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon John

customer_reviews.title: Makes an ordinarily difficult job of carrying large panel sheets much easier.
customer_reviews.text: Good design, sturdy, and easy to use. Need more use to judge durability.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's much heavier than I expected but durable. Use it daily for 5/8"x10' rock.
customer_reviews.author: J.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great to move drywall around
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Would recommend to anyone moving boards drywall/plywood by themselves. Note this doesn’t make the sheets lighter. Just more manageable
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Sure does make carrying plywood easier when you are by yourself !
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bittinger

customer_reviews.title: Good tool and value
customer_reviews.text: This makes carrying large sheets much easier. Very well built.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Saves your back, not for a pro but this hobbyist loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Rick P. Landwehr

customer_reviews.title: Life saver if you are solo
customer_reviews.text: My back is significantly jacked up. With this guy in can still work.
customer_reviews.author: LBH

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for lifting drywall and plywood.
customer_reviews.text: This tool saves backs and injury. Very handy as you become chronologically gifted.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic, if you plan on moving 8 x 4 sheets of anything by yourself, buy this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M.

customer_reviews.title: ... my house to the back which made process very easy. The gator lift works great & easy on ...
customer_reviews.text: I had 10-4' x 8' plywood sheets to take from my front of my house to the back which made process very easy. The gator lift works great & easy on your back.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my hubby and its the best thing i gave him! He dies not ask me to help him lift heavy wood! 👍👍👍👍👍❤️❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Simple but effective tool. Really helpful to carry drywall or plywood.
customer_reviews.author: John Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to not only pick up and move my sheets of dry wall - but was able to lift it up and lay on a table all with one hand!! GREAT product - wish I had one years ago when I hung sheet rock for a living!
customer_reviews.author: RPD

customer_reviews.title: Great for one man operation !
customer_reviews.text: works great. you can really throw the sheetrock around tight corners. great for one man carrying rock
customer_reviews.author: DR BOB

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product!
customer_reviews.text: The Gator Lift is very sturdy. I raised 6 sheets of 3/4” plywood from the ground up onto a two story play ground structure. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Gator Lift. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Gilbert

product_meta.title: Gator Lift Plywood Carrier
feature_bullets: HEAVY-DUTY HOLDER FOR CARRYING DRYWALL, PLYWOOD, ETC. - Gator Lift presents one of the most innovative tools for lifting and carrying all kinds of plywood, panels, sheets, and slabs. Use the Gator Lift to grip and carry MDO or MDF panels, OSB, melamine, drywall, tabletops, sheet metal, and other sheet goods. The self-adjusting gripper accommodates panel thicknesses of 0 to 1 ⅛ inch.

GRIP HANDLE FOR ONE-HAND CARRYING - This panel/plywood lifter features a durable, impact-resistant ABS handle that makes it easy for a single person to lift and carry full sheets of material with only one hand. The clamp can hold up to two sheets or panels at once, accommodating loads of up to 200 pounds. Get the job done quicker with this convenient sheet and panel mover.

SOLID METAL CONSTRUCTION - This tool, Designed and Engineered in the USA, is built to last, with a heavy-duty solid metal construction. The clamp and the handle arm are machined from aerospace-grade aluminum, while the joint is made from a solid steel bar. The handle itself is made of durable, impact-resistant ABS polymer. This high-quality construction ensures that the tool can hold up to a lifetime of strenuous use.

EASY ON YOUR BACK - Carrying drywall, plywood, and sheet goods can be very hard on your back. This handy tool takes the strain off your back and allows you to carry heavy materials with a single hand. Rather than bending over to lift materials from the bottom, simply place the clamp over the top edge of the material, then lift. The self-adjusting clamp holds materials tight as you lift.

SELF-ADJUSTING GRIPPER CLAMP - This piece of equipment by Gator Lift has a versatile, yet simple design that allows the clamp to grip onto a variety of different kinds of panels and sheet goods. As soon as you start lifting, the clamp automatically adjusts to the thickness of the panel or sheet. This innovative tool can hold up to two panels or sheets simultaneously.
